paper.title: Time-varying neural network for stock return prediction
paper.abstract: We consider the problem of neural network training in a time-varying context. Machine learning algorithms have excelled in problems that do not change over time. However, problems encountered in financial markets are often time varying. We propose the online early stopping algorithm and show that a neural network trained using this algorithm can track a function changing with unknown dynamics. We compare the proposed algorithm to current approaches on predicting monthly US stock returns and show its superiority. We also show that prominent factors (such as the size and momentum effects) and industry indicators exhibit time-varying predictive power on stock returns. We find that during market distress, industry indicators experience an increase in importance at the expense of firm level features. This indicates that industries play a role in explaining stock returns during periods of heightened risk.

domain_result.justification: 该论文的核心技术是使用时间变化的神经网络预测股票回报，这直接关联到投资组合管理中的资产选择和回报预测。论文还讨论了市场风险时期行业指标的重要性变化，这与投资组合的风险调整和资产配置相关。
